channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: Get an Apple MDM Push certificate for Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Get an Apple MDM Push certificate to manage iOS/iPadOS devices with Intune.

item.title: Enroll devices using a device enrollment manager account - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the device enrollment manager account to enroll devices in Intune.

item.title: Enable MDM automatic enrollment for Windows - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable Intune automatic enrollment for Windows devices joining or registering with your Microsoft Entra ID.

item.title: Add corporate identifiers to Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add corporate identifiers (enrollment method, IMEI, and serial numbers) to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Overview of enrollment restrictions - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the enrollment restrictions available in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Connect Intune account to managed Google Play account - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to connect your Intune account to your Managed Google Play account.

item.title: Bulk enrollment for Windows devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create a bulk enrollment package for Microsoft Intune

item.title: Enroll Android Enterprise dedicated, fully managed, or corporate-owned work profile devices in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll Android Enterprise dedicated, fully managed, or corporate-owned work profile devices in Intune.

item.title: Set up Intune enrollment for Android Enterprise dedicated devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure enrollment in Microsoft Intune for Android Enterprise dedicated devices.

item.title: iOS/iPadOS direct enrollment - Apple Configurator-Setup Assistant - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Apple Configurator to enroll corporate-owned iOS/iPadOS devices with Setup Assistant.

item.title: Tutorial - Use Apple Business Manager to enroll iOS/iPadOS devices in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this tutorial, you'll set up Apple corporate device enrollment features with Intune to enroll iOS/iPadOS devices purchased through Apple Business Manager.

item.title: Set up enrollment for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up enrollment for macOS devices in Intune.

item.title: Set up the Enrollment Status Page in the admin center copy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up a greeting page for users signing in and enrolling Windows devices copy.

item.title: Categorize devices into groups in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Categorize Intune-managed devices into groups for easier management in the admin center.

item.title: Understand Intune and Microsoft Entra device limit restrictions - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn the differences between Intune device limit restrictions and Microsoft Entra device limit restrictions.

item.title: Set up web based device enrollment - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up web-based device enrollment to manage user-owned iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage Intune devices with Android device administrator - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Android device administrator with Intune to manage devices.

item.title: Set up Android (AOSP) device management in Intune for corporate-owned userless devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Intune for corporate-owned userless devices built on the Android Open Source Project (AOSP) platform.

item.title: Enable autodiscovery of Intune enrollment server - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Simplify enrollment for users by enabling automatic discovery of the Intune enrollment server.

item.title: Set up Android (AOSP) device management in Intune for corporate-owned user-associated devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Intune for corporate-owned user-associated devices built on the Android Open Source Project (AOSP) platform.

item.title: Enroll personal devices in Intune with Android Enterprise work profile management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Intune for personal devices and bring-your-own-device scenarios using Android Enterprise work profile management.

item.title: Set up Android Enterprise work profile for corporate owned devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Android Enterprise work profile for corporate-owned devices enrolling in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up automatic enrollment in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable Intune automatic enrollment of Windows 10/11 devices that join or register with your Microsoft Entra ID.

item.title: Overview of Apple device enrollment in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Utilize Apple device enrollment to enroll and manage user-owned iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Authentication methods for Apple automated device enrollment - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Describes the Intune-supported authentication methods you can use with automated device enrollment.

item.title: Require multifactor authentication for Intune device enrollment - Microsoft Intune
item.description: How to require multifactor authentication in Microsoft Entra ID for Intune device enrollment.

item.title: Create device platform restrictions - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Restrict personally owned devices, and specific device platforms and OS versions from enrolling in Intune.

item.title: Automatically enroll devices with Samsung Knox Mobile Enrollment - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll Android devices in Microsoft Intune with the Knox Mobile Enrollment tool.

item.title: Set up user enrollment with Company Portal for iOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up the profile based Apple User Enrollment option for personal devices enrolling in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use direct enrollment for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Deploy and enroll macOS devices in Microsoft Intune using direct enrollment with Apple Configurator.

item.title: Set up enrollment notifications in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up enrollment notifications in Intune for employees or students.

item.title: Evaluate and try - Enroll a device - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this evaluation task, enroll a device running Windows 10/11 into Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Security Copilot in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: You can use Security Copilot to get information about your Intune data, including devices, apps, policies, and groups managed in Intune. You can also compare policies, get device specific details, and get target info for policies.

item.title: Configure ChromeOS connector for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to connect the Google Admin Console to Microsoft Intune so that you can view and take action on enrolled ChromeOS devices.

item.title: Back up and restore iOS/iPadOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about backup and restore scenarios for iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Create device limit restrictions - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Restrict the number of devices allowed to enroll in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set terms and conditions in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set terms and conditions that users see in the Company Portal for Intune.

item.title: Device staging overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: An overview of device staging, Android Enterprise token types, and token management in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: View enrollment reports - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Monitor and troubleshoot issues with enrollment restrictions and enrollment status page assignments.

item.title: Set up Apple device management in Intune for corporate-owned userless devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up Intune for corporate-owned userless iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Move Android devices from device administrator to personally owned work profile management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Move Android devices from device administrator to personally owned work profile management in Intune.

item.title: Incomplete user enrollments report overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Access your organization's incomplete user enrollments report generated by Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Move from Android device administrator to mobile application management - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to set up mobile application management, an alternative option to Android device administrator that focuses on app protection and doesn't require device enrollment.

item.title: Apple School Manager Program enrollment for iOS/iPadOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to set up Microsoft Intune with Apple School Manager for corporate-owned iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Apple School Manager - get Apple token and assign devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Get the Apple token needed to set up Apple School Manager and Microsoft Intune for corporate-owned iOS/iPadOS devices.

item.title: Apple School Manager - create enrollment profile - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to create the enrollment profile in Intune for Apple School Manager enrollment.

item.title: Security Copilot in Intune features overview - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Security Copilot in Intune is an AI platform. It can help you create policies, get information about existing policies, and show more details on specific settings, including their impacts on users and devices. You can also use Copilot to troubleshoot device issues and query devices.

item.title: Explore Intune data with natural language and take action - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In Microsoft Intune, use Explorer to query your data in natural language and run built-in queries that match your request. Copilot summarizes the results, and provides recommendations and actions based on the query results. You can also create policies that target users and groups in the query results. Use this feature to explore your Intune data, troubleshoot issues, and create custom reports.

item.title: Set up automated device enrollment for shared device mode - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to set up Apple automated device enrollment for iOS/iPadOS devices in shared device mode, a feature of Microsoft Entra.

item.title: Set up enrollment for Android Enterprise fully managed devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up enrollment in Intune for devices using the Android Enterprise fully managed device management solution.

item.title: Shared iPad devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Shared iPad devices.

item.title: Apple School Manager - sync and distribute devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Sync and distribute Apple School Manager devices enrolled in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Shared iOS and iPadOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Shared iOS and iPadOS devices.

item.title: Set up enrollment time grouping - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Overview and setup of the enrollment time grouping feature in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Set up automated device enrollment (ADE) for iOS/iPadOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll corporate-owned iOS/iPadOS devices into Microsoft Intune with Apple Automated Device Enrollment (ADE).

item.title: Set up local admin account creation and password management for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up macOS account configuration with LAPS through automatic device enrollment for macOS devices in Intune.

item.title: Set up account driven Apple User Enrollment - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up account driven Apple User Enrollment for personal devices enrolling in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Enable Windows Backup for Organizations in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable Windows backup and restore in Intune for employees or students.

item.title: Microsoft Security Copilot agents in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Security Copilot agents in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Security Copilot in Microsoft Surface Management Portal - Microsoft Intune
item.description: You can use Security Copilot to help you manage and monitor Surface devices at scale.

item.title: Set up just-in-time registration - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Set up JIT registration in Intune for devices enrolling via a supported Apple device enrollment or user enrollment method.

item.title: Windows enrollment attestation - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Find out how the Device attestation status report can help you and learn to use the Attest device action to ensure your devices are secure and reliable.

item.title: Overview of Apple User Enrollment in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Utilize Apple User Enrollment to enroll and manage user-owned iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Turn on iOS/iPadOS supervised mode with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to turn on iOS/iPadOS supervised mode with Intune.

item.title: Overview of Android work profile management in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about Android Enterprise work profile management, a device management option for personal and corporate-owned devices enrolling in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Copilot in Intune shows device information and helps troubleshoot - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Microsoft Security Copilot in Intune can help you get information about your devices, compare devices, and get error information. Use this information to help you manage and troubleshoot device issues.

item.title: FAQ for Microsoft Copilot in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Get answers to common questions when using Copilot in Microsoft Intune, including accessing Copilot, licensing, and more.

item.title: Set up automated device enrollment (ADE) for macOS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enroll corporate-owned Macs into Microsoft Intune with Apple Automated Device Enrollment (ADE).

item.title: In development - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes Microsoft Intune features that are in development.

item.title: Assign a role to an Intune administrator - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to assign a built-in or custom role to a user in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Prerequisites the Microsoft Tunnel VPN for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review the prerequisites for installation and use of the Microsoft Tunnel Gateway. These include Linux servers, network, and firewall configurations.

item.title: Security Copilot Vulnerability Remediation Agent in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to set up and use the Vulnerability Remediation Agent for Security Copilot in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Configure Platform SSO for macOS devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune to configure Platform SSO and deploy the configuration to your macOS devices. Platform SSO enables single sign-on (SSO) using Microsoft Entra ID with the Secure Enclave, smart card, or password authentication methods. You create a settings catalog policy to configure the settings. This article is a step-by-step guide to configure Platform SSO for macOS devices using Intune.

item.title: Create a policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to configure thousands of settings for Windows 10/11, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, and Android client devices, including Microsoft Office apps, Microsoft Edge, and more. Add these settings in a device configuration profile to secure devices, and control different programs and features. Use Microsoft Copilot to get What If analysis, and learn more about each setting.

item.title: Assign device profiles in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Microsoft Intune admin center to assign device configuration profiles and policies to users and devices. Learn how to exclude groups from a profile assignment in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use ADMX templates on Windows devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Administrative templates in Microsoft Intune to create groups of settings for Windows 10/11 client devices. Use these settings in a device configuration profile. You can control Office programs, Microsoft Edge, access OneDrive, use remote desktop, enable Auto-Play, set power management settings, use HTTP printing, control user sign-in, and change the event log size.

item.title: Properties catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure Properties catalog policy to manage Device Inventory settings on Windows devices you manage with Intune.

item.title: Use Microsoft Intune to import and analyze group policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Import and analyze your group policy objects using the Group Policy analytics tool. See the policies that are supported and aren't supported in Intune.

item.title: Configure Universal Print policy using settings catalog in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the settings catalog in Microsoft Intune to create a Universal Print policy for Windows 10/11 client devices. The policy automatically installs printers on your managed devices.

item.title: Configure device configuration profiles in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or configure a device configuration profile in Microsoft Intune. Select the platform type, configure the settings, and add a scope tag. Learn more about applicability rules, and the policy refresh cycle times.

item.title: Configure macOS Enterprise SSO app extension with MDMs - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about the Microsoft Enterprise single sign-on (SSO) app extension plug-in. Add or create an macOS device profile using the SSO app extension in Microsoft Intune, Jamf Pro, and other MDM solution providers.

item.title: Restrict devices features using policy in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add a device configuration profile to restrict features on Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, AOSP, macOS, iOS, iPadOS, and Windows 10/11 client devices in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Create a Wi-Fi profile for devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See the steps to create a Wi-Fi device configuration profile in Microsoft Intune. Create profiles for Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, Android kiosk, iOS, iPadOS, macOS, Windows 10/11, and Windows Holographic for Business. Use these profiles to create a WiFi connection to use certificates, choose an EAP type, select an authentication method, enable a proxy, and more.

item.title: Shared or multi-user Windows device settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add and use Windows 10/11 and Windows Holographic for Business devices that are shared, or used by multiple users in Microsoft Intune. See a list of all the settings and what they do on the devices, including Microsoft HoloLens. Control guest accounts, manage accounts and delete inactive accounts, allow or prevent saving to local storage, set power and sleep options, choose when updates are installed, and use devices in education environments in a device configuration profile.

item.title: Device features and settings in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Overview of the different Microsoft Intune device profiles. Get info on GPO, features, restrictions, email, wifi, VPN, education, certificates, upgrade Windows 10/11, BitLocker and Microsoft Defender, administrative templates, and custom device configuration settings in the Microsoft Intune admin center. Use these profiles to manage and protect data and devices in your company.

item.title: Update Windows BIOS using configuration MDM policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about the BIOS configuration profile that can manage traditional BIOS settings in Microsoft Intune. You use an OEM tool to create a configuration file with the settings. You deploy an OEM Win32 app to the devices to read the configuration file and BIOS passwords. Then, you create a BIOS configuration policy in Intune to add the configuration file and assign the policy to your devices.

item.title: Add VPN settings to devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: On Android device administrator, Android Enterprise, iOS, iPadOS, macOS, and Windows devices, use built-in settings to create virtual private network (VPN) connections in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Migrate your imported group policy to a policy in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: After you import your Windows group policy objects in Microsoft Intune, use the migrate feature to transfer your GPOs to a Settings Catalog policy. This policy uses your imported GPOs, and can be assigned to users and devices managed by your organizations.

item.title: Kiosk settings for Windows and Holographic devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure your Windows 10/11 and Windows Holographic for Business devices as single-app and multi-app kiosks, customize the start menu, add apps, show the task bar, and configure a web browser in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: See device configuration policies with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See and manage the device configuration policy details in Microsoft Intune. Look at a graphical chart of the number of devices assigned to a policy, and see which devices have policies assigned or deployed. Can also troubleshoot policies that have conflict settings.

item.title: Set up per-app VPN for iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See the prerequisites, create a group for the virtual private network (VPN) users, add a SCEP certificate profile, configure a per-app VPN profile, and assign some apps to the VPN profile in Microsoft Intune on iOS/iPadOS devices. Also lists the steps to verify the VPN connection on the device.

item.title: Create iOS/iPadOS or macOS device profile with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add or create an iOS, iPadOS, or macOS device profile. Configure settings for AirPrint, layout of the home screen, app notifications, shared device, single sign-on, and web content filter settings in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Import Wi-Fi settings for Windows devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Export Wi-Fi settings from a Windows device as an XML file using the network shell (netsh wlan) command. Then, import this file in Intune to create a Wi-Fi profile for devices running Windows 10/11 and Windows Holographic for Business.

item.title: Create Wi-Fi profile with preshared key in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use a custom profile to create a Wi-Fi profile with a preshared key (PSK), and get sample XML code for Android, Android Enterprise, Windows, and EAP-based Wi-Fi profiles in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Update Windows BIOS features using DFCI MDM policies - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about the Device Firmware Configuration Interface (DFCI) profile to manage UEFI settings in Microsoft Intune. To use DFCI profiles, create Microsoft Entra security groups, the Windows Autopilot deployment profile, and the Enrollment State Page profile.

item.title: Set permissions to Managed Home Screen using Android Enterprise OEMConfig - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Add the Samsung Knox Service Plugin, Zebra OEMConfig Powered by MX, and Legacy Zebra OEMConfig apps to Intune, and use the app schemas to configure permissions for the Managed Home Screen (MHS) app on Android Enterprise devices.

item.title: eSIM configuration of a download server - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about configuration of an eSIM Download Server from Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure 802.1x wired network settings for macOS and Windows devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create or add a wired network device configuration profile or policy using the IEEE 802.1X standard for macOS, Windows 10, and Windows 11 devices and computers. See the different settings, add certificates, choose an EAP type, and select an authentication method in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add custom settings to iOS/iPadOS devices in Microsoft Intune
item.description: Export iOS and iPadOS settings from Apple Configurator or Apple Profile Manager tools, and then import these settings into Microsoft Intune. These settings can create, use, and control custom settings and features on iOS/iPadOS devices. This custom profile can then be assigned or distributed to iOS/iPadOS devices in your organization to create a baseline or standard.

item.title: Create macOS system and kernel extensions with Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn more about system extensions and kernel extensions for macOS devices. In Microsoft Intune, add or create a device configuration policy that configures kernel extensions. In the extension, you can allow user override, add a team identifier, and add a bundle and team identifier.
